bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to regulate unsolicited electronic commerce. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any contract entered in response to an unsolicited facsimile or electronic mail offer to sell, lease, or provide any property, good, service, or extension of credit may be cancelled by the recipient within ten days of entering the contract by providing notice in writing or by returning any property or goods received in substantially the same condition as received. Any person who has received such notice of cancellation shall, within ten business days: (1) Refund any payment made under the contract; (2) Return any goods or property traded or exchanged under the contract; and (3) Take all steps necessary to terminate the contract and place the parties in the same positions they held prior to entering the contract. No person cancelling a contract under this section is liable for money damages, specific performance, or penalty arising from the contract. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to regulate unsolicited electronic commerce. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any contract entered in response to an unsolicited facsimile or electronic mail offer to sell, lease, or provide any property, good, service, or extension of credit may be cancelled by the recipient within three days of receipt of the goods contracted for by providing electronic, facsimile, or written notice or by returning any property or goods received in substantially the same condition as received. Any person who has received such notice of cancellation shall, within ten business days: (1) Refund any payment made under the contract; (2) Return any goods or property traded or exchanged under the contract; and (3) Take all steps necessary to terminate the contract and place the parties in the same positions they held prior to entering the contract. No person cancelling a contract under this section is liable for money damages, specific performance, or penalty arising from the contract. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to regulate unsolicited electronic commerce. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any contract entered in response to an unsolicited facsimile or electronic mail offer to sell, lease, or provide any property, good, or service may be cancelled by the recipient within three days of entering the contract or within three days of receipt of the goods contracted for, whichever is later, by providing electronic, facsimile, or written notice or by returning any property or goods received in substantially the same condition as received. Any person who has received such notice of cancellation shall, within three business days: (1) Refund any payment made under the contract; (2) Return any goods or property traded or exchanged under the contract; and (3) Take all steps necessary to terminate the contract and place the parties in the same positions they held prior to entering the contract. No person cancelling a contract under this section is liable for money damages, specific performance, or penalty arising from the contract. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to regulate unsolicited electronic commerce. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 37-24-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SUBDIVISION to read as follows: Send or cause to be sent an unsolicited commercial electronic mail message that does not include in the subject line of such message "ADV:" as the first four characters. If the message contains information that consists of explicit sexual material that may only be viewed, purchased, rented, leased, or held in possession by an individual eighteen years of age and older, the subject line of each message shall include "ADV:ADLT" as the first eight characters. An unsolicited commercial electronic mail message does not include a message sent to a person with whom the initiator has an existing personal or business relationship or a message sent at the request or express consent of the recipient. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
